intro: Pavetta laoticensis, commonly known as the Laos pavetta, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and have a distinct aromatic scent. Pavetta laoticensis produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange-red berries.
